meanings.def: the top part of your legs that forms a flat surface when you are sitting down
examples: on somebody's lap There's only one seat so you'll have to sit on my lap.
in somebody's lap She sat with her hands in her lap.

meanings.def: one journey from the beginning to the end of a track used for running, etc.
examples: the fastest lap on record
She has completed six laps.
He was overtaken on the final lap.
to do a lap of honour (= go around the track again to celebrate winning)
(North American English) to do a victory lap
He took a quick lap around the empty rink.
He tripped and fell on the final lap.
He was swimming laps in the pool.
I skated a victory lap around the rink.
The fastest lap was completed at 208 mph.
The silver medallist joined the winner in a lap of honour.
The winner did a lap of honour.
an indoor heated lap pool
Alonso was leading at the end of lap five.
He immediately set the fastest lap of the race.
The 800m is two laps of the track.
The crowd cheered while the athletes ran their lap of honour.

meanings.def: a section of a journey, or of a piece of work, etc.
examples: on the… lap They're off on the first lap of their round-the-world tour.
We've nearly finished. We're on the last lap.

meanings.def: to make something the responsibility of another person
examples: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.

meanings.def: somebody has the opportunity to do something pleasant without having made any effort
examples: My dream job just fell into my lap.

meanings.def: if the result of something is in the lap of the gods, you do not know what will happen because it depends on luck or things you cannot control
in easy, comfortable conditions, and enjoying the advantages of being rich
examples: We spent two weeks in the hotel living in the lap of luxury.

meanings.def: to touch something gently and regularly, often making a soft sound
examples: The waves lapped around our feet.
the sound of water lapping against the boat
The freezing water lapped over her boots.
The water lapped around his ankles.
The waves lapped at his feet.
The waves lapped gently against the side of the ship.

meanings.def: to drink something with quick movements of the tongue
to pass another runner on a track who is one or more laps behind you
examples: She had already lapped most of the other runners.
